articles.author: Judy
articles.description:
When data analysis involves different business systems, cross-database computations become necessary. Of these computations, JOIN between tables are particularly challenging, as many databases lack this capability. Although Java can retrieve data and perform calculations, it is too complex. esProc offers a much simpler solution for cross-database JOIN operations.
A vehicle management system (DB_Vehicle) stores information about vehicles and their owners. The simplified structure for the owner_info table is shown below:

The simplified structure for the vehicle_master table is as follows:

A traffic management system (DB_Traffic) stores vehicle traffic information. The structure of the traffic_violation table is as follows:



The traffic_violation and vehicle_master tables also exhibit a m‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Implement JOIN Operations Between Tables from Different Databases with esProc?

articles.author: Om Shree
articles.description:
Hey, tech explorers! üåü Today, let‚Äôs dive into a fun and slightly sneaky greedy problem ‚Äî LeetCode 2434: Using a Robot to Print the Lexicographically Smallest String. We'll crack it open using an intuitive stack-based greedy approach. üí°
You're given a string s, and a robot holding an empty string t. The robot can:
Remove the first character from s and append it to t.
Remove the last character from t and write it onto paper.
You keep performing these operations until both s and t are empty.
üìù Goal: Return the lexicographically smallest string that can be written on paper.
We need to cleverly decide when to pop from t and write to the paper so the final string is smallest in order. The key:
Maintain the minimum character ahead of each position in s.
Use a stack to simulate t.
Whenever the ‚Ä¶
articles.title: ü§ñ Greedy Robot & Lexicographically Smallest String | LeetCode 2434 (C++ | JavaScript | Python)

articles.author: Sharon
articles.description:
About Author
Hi, I'm Sharon, a product manager at Chaitin Tech. We build SafeLine, an open-source Web Application Firewall built for real-world threats. While SafeLine focuses on HTTP-layer protection, our emergency response center monitors and responds to RCE and authentication vulnerabilities across the stack to help developers stay safe.
DataEase, an open-source data visualization platform, has recently been found vulnerable to a series of high-risk flaws that allow unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (RCE) and authentication bypass. These vulnerabilities ‚Äî now publicly disclosed ‚Äî pose a serious risk to internet-facing deployments.
In June 2025, multiple security advisories were published disclosing the following CVEs:
CVE-2025-48999


CVE-2025-49002

CVE-2025-49001
When chained toge‚Ä¶
articles.title: Critical RCE Vulnerabilities Found in DataEase (CVE-2025-49001/49002)

articles.author: Akash
articles.description:
Introduction


In Kubernetes, taints and tolerations are mechanisms that allow you to control where pods are scheduled in a cluster. They provide fine-grained control over node-pod placement, ensuring that pods run on appropriate nodes based on specific requirements, such as hardware capabilities, workload priorities, or maintenance schedules. This tutorial explains what taints and tolerations are, how they work, and how to use them effectively with practical examples.
Basic understanding of Kubernetes concepts (pods, nodes, scheduling).
A Kubernetes cluster (e.g., Minikube, Kind, or a cloud-based cluster like GKE, EKS, or AKS).
kubectl installed and configured to interact with your cluster.
A taint is a property applied to a node that repels pods from being scheduled on it unless those po‚Ä¶
articles.title: Mastering Kubernetes Scheduling: A Comprehensive Guide to Taints and Tolerations

articles.author: Kedar Kodgire
articles.description:
Generative AI (short for Generative Artificial Intelligence) is like a super-smart robot that can create things. Think of it as your creative buddy that can write wild stories, paint colorful masterpieces, compose music that sounds like it's from a movie, build fun little games, or even help you brainstorm amazing ideas for a science fair or school project ‚Äî all in just seconds. And the best part? You can quickly try it out for yourself at 
https://deepmind.google/models/veo/
But it doesn‚Äôt come up with these things out of thin air. It learns from a lot of examples ‚Äî like reading a mountain of books, looking at millions of pictures, or listening to entire libraries of songs ‚Äî and then it uses that knowledge to make something brand new.

Here are just a few of the amazing things Gen AI can do:

Because Generative AI is becoming a part of everything! From the video games you play and YouTube videos you watch, to the chatbots you talk to and learning apps you use ‚Äî AI is already quietly working behind the scenes. It helps make apps smarter, answers quicker, and creativity even more fun.
Understanding this tech is like learning a new kind of superpower ‚Äî one that mixes creativity and science. For example, imagine creating your own AI that draws a dragon eating spaghetti on the moon ‚Äî you just describe it, and boom, it appears. Cool, right?
¬†¬†¬†¬†‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†Generative AI = A robot that learns and makes cool stuff
Coming Up Next:
Got questions? Ask them in the comments. This blog is for curious minds like yours!
‚ú® About This Series: This blog series is all about making Generative AI easy to understand, even if you‚Äôve never heard of it before. Whether you're 10 or just curious like a 10-year-old, I‚Äôll walk through the big ideas using fun examples and simple words. You‚Äôll go from ‚ÄúWhat is this stuff?‚Äù to ‚ÄúWhoa, I get it!‚Äù ‚Äî one post at a time.
articles.title: What is Generative AI? Like I‚Äôm 10!

articles.author: DPC
articles.description:
Daily JavaScript Challenge: Find the Longest Increasing Subsequence


Hey fellow developers! üëã Welcome to today's JavaScript coding challenge. Let's keep those programming skills sharp! 
Difficulty: Medium

Topic: Dynamic Programming
Given an array of integers, find the length of the longest subsequence that is strictly increasing. A subsequence is derived from the array by deleting some elements (possibly none) without changing the order of the remaining elements.
https://www.dpcdev.com/
Fork this challenge
Write your solution
Test it against the provided test cases
Share your approach in the comments below!
Check out the documentation about this topic here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longest_increasing_subsequence
How did you approach this problem?
Did you find any interesting edge cases?
What was your biggest learning from this challenge?
Let's learn together! Drop your thoughts and questions in the comments below. üëá
This is part of our Daily JavaScript Challenge series. Follow me for daily programming challenges and let's grow together! üöÄ


  
  
  javascript #programming #coding #dailycodingchallenge #webdev
articles.title: Daily JavaScript Challenge #JS-199: Find the Longest Increasing Subsequence

articles.author: Gaming News
articles.description:
Summary

Early adopters of the Nintendo Switch 2 had their big launch-night moment ruined when GameStop employees at a Staten Island location stapled purchase receipts directly onto the console boxes‚Äîpuncturing delicate screens through the thin cardboard and plastic packaging. Dozens of fans shared photos on Twitter and Reddit showing staple holes in their brand-new units, sparking frustration over both the retailer‚Äôs careless handling and Nintendo‚Äôs apparently minimal internal protection for its flagship device.
What‚Äôs Next?

IGN reached out to GameStop and Nintendo, and a GameStop spokesperson has since pledged to ‚Äúmake customers whole.‚Äù Meanwhile, gamers are warning friends to inspect their consoles immediately and retailers to rethink receipt practices‚Äîbecause no one wants their $500 gaming machine to double as a pin cushion.
articles.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Screen Punctures Ruin Launch Day for Fans Due to GameStop Receipts Stapled Into Console's Box
